what: Fast, Lightweight MICE using Random Forests
title: Fast, Lightweight MICE using Random Forests
text: micerf stripped-version Multiple Imputation using Chained Equations (MICE) Fully Conditional Specification (FCS) equations either random forests sampling training values models. designed efficiency, stability, minimal dependencies. also provides integration mlr3 machine learning toolkit using suggested packages.

title: Fast, Lightweight MICE using Random Forests
text: can install development version micerf like : Note need Rtools installed Windows build packages Github.
code: # Install {remotes} if (!"remotes" %in% installed.packages()) install.packages("remotes") # Install {micerf} from Github remotes::install_github("jesse-smith/micerf")

title: {R6} Class Containing the State of a MICE Model + Data Set — Mids
text: data [data.table] data impute. Can modified (reference assignment) self$iteration == 0. m [integer(1)] number chains (imputed data sets) create. Can modified self$iteration == 0. predictor_matrix [logical matrix] matrix rows representing response variables (impute) columns representing predictor variables (use imputation). assigning, must square matrix number rows columns variables self$data, row/column ordering must match column order self$data. [logical matrix] matrix dimensions self$data indicating values impute (TRUE) ignore (FALSE). Can modified self$iteration == 0. iteration [integer(1)] number iterations performed. Can assigned value greater equal current value. chunk_size [integer(1)] average number chains assign future. Can modified self$iteration == 0. seed [integer(1)] Seed random number generation. Can NULL.
